snippet: Some Wall Street chiefs and banking watchdogs warn that turbulence in the bond market could make it harder for companies and countries to borrow.
abstract: Wall street chiefs, top bank regulators and other industry voices are warning about potentially dire vulnerability in global bond market; fear is that sudden event like surprise increase in interest rates could rapidly inhibit trading, causing wild fluctuations in bond prices and constriction in the availability of credit; cite prolonged rally in bond prices and vast stimulus by central banks as main causes.
lead_paragraph: Some Wall Street chiefs and banking watchdogs warn that turbulence in the bond market could make it harder for companies and countries to borrow.

headline.main: Bankers and Regulators Voice Fears on Bond Market Volatility
headline.print_headline: Bankers and Regulators Voice Fears on Bond Market

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
